subject: Re: [junit] JUnit works great in IDE, how do I run it from a shell?

messageBody:
[I have already answered this question on a mailing list for NetBeans
users so I resend it here]

The problem was that 'junit.jar' file required by the <junit> task is
not included in the Ant distribution. So you have to direct Ant to that
file. E.g.

ant -lib /usr/local/java/junit3.8.1/junit.jar test

The 'junit.jar' is also bundled with NetBeans so you can also use it:

ant -lib /apps/NetBeans-5.0/ide6/modules/ext/junit-3.8.1.jar

In the next version of NetBeans, following NB 5.5, it should be possible
to run a test without the -lib ... switch thanks to an improvement of
the junit.jar library.


As for generating report files, there is no direct support for this in
NetBeans. The output generated by the test is put the to NetBeans output
window so you can copy it from there - no need to run the tests from a
command line.

To get a nice report, you can modify you project's build.xml file as
described in John C.'s blog:
http://blogs.sun.com/roller/page/johnc?entry=give_your_junit_test_results

Marian
